description.narrative: By 2022, Dominican institutions will have the capacity to protect children and adolescents in a situation of transit and migration between Haiti and the Dominican Republic., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable children and adolescents will be able to exercise their rights to an identity, to live in a family and to be protected against violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, Dominican institutions will have the capacity to protect children and adolescents in a situation of transit and migration between Haiti and the Dominican Republic.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to prevent children´s deportation and strengthened the capacity of the Dominican authorities in charge of migration and of child protection to address the specific rights of children on the move, as well as the local coordination of child protection institutions and migration authorities on both sides of the the Dominican-Haitian border. In 2019, the number of undocumented migrant children taken to the cross-border area for deportation procedures by Dominican authorities has been reduced by 18% in comparison to 2018. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of Child Protection Networks created or strengthened on the border region
Number of children on the move who receive protective services through UNICEF-supported programs
